SEARCH

Class Time

java.lang.Object
Time
public class Time extends Object
Author:
zbist This class is used to make and work with times. A time has hours, minutes, and seconds. You can print the time, compare two times, and add them together.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Time()
    Makes a new time set to 0 hours, 0 minutes, and 0 seconds.
    Time(int hours, int minutes, double seconds)
    Makes a new time with the given hours, minutes, and seconds.

      Parameters:
      hours - how many hours
      minutes - how many minutes
      seconds - how many seconds

    • printTime

      public static void printTime(Time t)
      Prints out a time in the format hh:mm:ss.s
      Parameters:
      t - the time to print

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Time that)
      Checks if this time is the same as another time. The times are the same if hours and minutes match, and the seconds are very close.
      Parameters:
      that - another time
      Returns:
      true if they are the same, false if not

    • add

      public Time add(Time that)
      Adds this time and another time together. If seconds or minutes go over 60, it fixes them. If hours go over 24, it wraps back around.
      Parameters:
      that - the other time
      Returns:
      a new time that is the sum

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Turns the time into a string that looks like hh:mm:ss.s
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the time as a string
